ITAL 470 La letteratura fantastica 
Content:  Fantasy, legend, and myths have been an integral part of literature through the ages and have always had a very strong influence on all forms of genre fiction. The habit of using real characters or situations and putting them in a world where things that are not expected to happen occur, has always had an appeal on readers. Writers have used fantasy in novels, poetry and short stories and directors have made many movies. 
This course will provide an overview of the fantastical elements in Italian culture through the analysis of short stories and film. The texts and movies will illustrate cultural topics from the 20th century to the present. We will also see, through real experiences, how people from one country imagine or fantasize about life in a different country, specifically within the context of immigration.
